file_content.text: Why do you insist on being a slave? With your power, you could do--be--anything.
You could rule worlds. Crush all enemies. Have any man you want.
You could rule worlds. Crush all enemies. Have any woman you want.
You can't tempt me with those things, Warren. I don't need them.
I am a Jedi.
That's the Council talking. Think for yourself!
All I'd have to do is become the Emperor's puppet--like you.
The price is too high.
You don't understand. The dark side will set you free.
How's the dark side working out for you, Warren?
Didn't do squat for you.
We both know how this ends. You'll send me back to Tython to be "redeemed." Eventually, I'll escape.
I've tasted real power. I'll never return to the Jedi.
This war is nearly over. Master Braga will lead the Empire to victory on Corellia. Billions will die.
The Emperor doesn't care about the war. He wants to destroy the galaxy--and you with it.
And seal the galaxy's fate.
I wonder if Braga knows that? Doesn't matter. Let it all burn.
You just told me how to stop the Emperor. Either you want that, or you're lying.
Why would you tell me that?
Maybe the Emperor's hold isn't as strong as it looks.
He wouldn't kill the admiral, and now this. I think he's trying to help.
Perhaps he doesn't care what you believe.
Never trust intel the enemy gives up easily.
Jedi Warren = good man // Emperor = can't change that
Why would I be afraid to tell you that you've already failed? Corellia will fall, and the Republic with it.
The knowledge in this man's head could destroy the Republic. He's a traitor. We can't let him live.
This man tricked me into revealing our fleet security codes. The Empire will annihilate us if that information gets out. He needs to die.
You've been useful, Warren, but I don't need you anymore.
Thanks for the tip. Now die.
Yes, kill him. He tricked me into revealing our fleet security codes. If that information gets out, the Empire will annihilate us.
He's a dangerous traitor. It's what he deserves.
That other Jedi snapped out of it, eventually. Maybe he will, too.
Last time I checked, Jedi weren't executioners.
We have no time to waste. Be done with this.
Summary executions are permitted under extraordinary circumstances. This qualifies.
Jedi Council = help Warren // Execution = opposite of help
We can't risk him escaping and telling the enemy what he knows. There's only one way to be sure that doesn't happen.
We will not kill a defenseless man. He was our ally once; I hope he will be again.
We're taking him alive.
Lock him up until other Jedi come to claim him. Understood, Admiral?
Weak as ever. This is why the Republic always fails.
I'll keep this traitor aboard on my terms. The ship's medtechs will sedate him until your people arrive.
If you're so certain he's dangerous, execute him. Don't ask me to do it.
Kill him yourself.
A lot of my fellow officers don't trust Jedi. I'm starting to see why.
This is war. We can't afford to be sentimental. Goodbye.
I agree. [Kill Warren]
I'm glad to see the Jedi are willing to clean up their own messes.
If this information about Corellia is true, our forces are in danger. We'd better mobilize everything we have.
I'll alert High Command. You inform your Council. Good luck.
Another step, and the admiral dies.
What happens to me doesn't matter. He's going to destroy us all. Kill him!
No one else needs to die. Talk to me, Warren.
I can end this peacefully.
No--don't let him get inside your head!
How can he destroy us all? It's only one ship.
What does that mean?
He did something to my mind. Made me reveal the security codes for our entire fleet.
This flagship belongs to the Empire. Stay, and the admiral's blood will be on your hands.
This isn't you, Warren. The Emperor is controlling you, but you can push him out. Focus.
You're not a killer.
No. No more pretending to be something I'm not. I'm finally free.
Is this what the Sith Empire has come to? Using old men as shields? I expected better, Warren.
Face me alone.
I've killed more than fifty Sith in my time. I'll kill just as many Jedi before I'm done.
If he has to die so I can stop you, so be it.
I can live with that.
The admiral outranks me. Guess I have to do as he says.
As you wish. [Fight]
You struggle against your restraints, yet you continue to serve the Jedi. Pathetic.
Youth won't save you. My master gave me all the strength I need to finish this....
